channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Don’t Repeat the Fannie and Freddie Mistake
item.description: Instead of talking about an IPO, Trump should be trying to wind down the government-sponsored entities.

item.title: Trump extends China tariff truce by another 90 days, pushing new deadline to November
item.description: For now, the extension of a truce means that US tariffs on Chinese goods this year stand at 30%.

item.title: There Aren’t Data to Support Anti-Natalism
item.description: Children are precious and valued as human beings, regardless of where their careers lead them.

item.title: When the next recession hits, whoever is president will face intense pressure to cut tariffs, so don’t rely on them for revenue, top economist says
item.description: “There’s going to be a strong incentive on that president’s part to say, ‘Okay, I’m going to cut the taxes.’”

item.title: Harvard Might Create a Conservative Center. Is It Real or Just Window Dressing?

item.title: Michael E. Hammond Made Washington And The World A Better Place
item.description: Mike Hammond’s life was proof that one person’s conviction and intellect can change the course of history.
